00020 
00021 #ifndef KM_DATA_H
00022 #define KM_DATA_H
00023 
00024 #include "KMeans.h"            // kmeans includes
00025 #include "KCtree.h"            // kc-tree includes
00026 
00027 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00028 //  KMdata - data point set
00029 //      This object represents a set of data points in d-space.  The
00030 //      array can be resized.  Doing so destroys the existing contents.
00031 // 
00032 //     In addition to the points, we also (optionally) provide a
00033 //     kc-tree data structure for the points as well.  This is
00034 //     constructed by first initializing the points and then calling
00035 //     buildKcTree().
00036 //
00037 //     We support a virtual function samplePt and samplePts, which
00038 //     sample one or a set of random center points.  In this version,
00039 //     the sample is just a random sample of the point set.  However,
00040 //     it is possible to derive classes from this in which sampling is
00041 //     done by some more sophisticated method.
00042 //
00043 //     Note that this structure does not support copying or
00044 //     assignments.  If you want to resuse the structure, the only way
00045 //     to do so is to first apply resize(), which destroys the kc-tree
00046 //     (if it exists), and then assign to it a new set of points.
00047 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00048 
00049 class KMdata {
00050 private:
00051     int            dim;        // dimension
00052     int            maxPts;        // max number of points
00053     int            nPts;        // number of data points
00054     KMdataArray        pts;        // the data points
00055     KCtree*        kcTree;        // kc-tree for the points
00056 private:                // copy functions (not implemented)
00057     KMdata(const KMdata& /*p*/)        // copy constructor
00058       { assert(false); }
00059     KMdata& operator=(const KMdata& /*p*/)    // assignment operator
00060       { assert(false);  return *this; }
00061 public:
00062     KMdata(int d, int n);        // standard constructor
00063 
00064     int getDim() const {        // get dimension
00065     return dim;
00066     }
00067     int getNPts() const {        // get number of points
00068     return nPts;
00069     }
00070     KMdataArray getPts() const {    // get the points
00071     return pts;
00072     }
00073     KCtree* getKcTree() const {        // get kc-tree
00074     return kcTree;
00075     }
00076     KMdataPoint& operator[](int i) {    // index
00077     return pts[i];
00078     }
00079     const KMdataPoint& operator[](int i) const {
00080     return pts[i];
00081     }
00082     void setNPts(int n) {        // set number of points
00083     assert(n <= maxPts);        // can't be more than array size
00084     nPts = n;
00085     }
00086     void buildKcTree();            // build the kc-tree for points
00087 
00088     virtual void sampleCtr(        // sample a center point
00089     KMpoint        sample);        // where to store sample
00090 
00091     virtual void sampleCtrs(        // sample center points
00092     KMpointArray    sample,            // where to store sample
00093     int        k,            // number of points to sample
00094     bool        allowDuplicate);    // allowing duplicates?
00095 
00096     void resize(int d, int n);        // resize array
00097 
00098     void print(                // print data points
00099         bool        fancy = true) {        // nicely formatted?
00100     kmPrintPts("Data_Points", pts, nPts, dim, fancy);
00101     }
00102 
00103     virtual ~KMdata();            // destructor
00104 };
00105 
00106 typedef KMdata* KMdataPtr;        // pointer to KMdata
00107 #endif
